item.title: Predicting Human Preferences Using the Block Structure of Complex Social Networks
item.description: Authors: Roger Guimerà, Alejandro Llorente, Esteban Moro y Marta Sales-Pardo Journal: PLoS ONE 7, e44620 (2012) LINK Abstract: With ever-increasing available data, predicting individuals' preferences and helping them locate the most relevant information has become a pressing need. Understanding and predicting preferences is also important from a fundamental point of view, as part of what has been called a “new” computational social science. Here, we propose a novel approach based on stochastic block models, which have been developed by sociologists as plausible models of complex networks of social interactions.
